title: Smart Data Models - ACDCConverter
description: Adapted from CIM data models. A unit with valves for three phases, together with unit control equipment, essential protective and switching devices, DC storage capacitors, phase reactors and auxiliaries, if any, used for conversion.

type.description: Property. NGSI type. It has to be ACDCConverter

PccTerminal.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. All converters` DC sides linked to this point of common coupling terminal. Default: None

baseS.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Base apparent power of the converter pole. Default: 0.0

idc.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Converter DC current, also called Id. Converter state variable, result from power flow. Default: 0.0

idleLoss.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Active power loss in pole at no power transfer. Converter configuration data used in power flow. Default: 0.0

maxUdc.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. The maximum voltage on the DC side at which the converter should operate. Converter configuration data used in power flow. Default: 0.0

minUdc.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Min allowed converter DC voltage. Converter configuration data used in power flow. Default: 0.0

numberOfValves.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Number of valves in the converter. Used in loss calculations. Default: 0

p.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Active power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used. Default: 0.0

poleLossP.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. The active power loss at a DC Pole  = idleLoss + switchingLoss*|Idc| + resitiveLoss*Idc^2 For lossless operation Pdc=Pac For rectifier operation with losses Pdc=Pac-lossP For inverter operation with losses Pdc=Pac+lossP Converter state variable used in power flow. Default: 0.0

q.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Reactive power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used. Default: 0.0

ratedUdc.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Rated converter DC voltage, also called UdN. Converter configuration data used in power flow. Default: 0.0

resistiveLoss.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Converter configuration data used in power flow. Refer to poleLossP. Default: 0.0

switchingLoss.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Switching losses, relative to the base apparent power `baseS`. Refer to poleLossP. Default: 0.0

targetPpcc.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Real power injection target in AC grid, at point of common coupling. Default: 0.0

targetUdc.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Target value for DC voltage magnitude. Default: 0.0

uc.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Converter voltage, the voltage at the AC side of the bridge. Converter state variable, result from power flow. Default: 0.0

udc.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Converter voltage at the DC side, also called Ud. Converter state variable, result from power flow. Default: 0.0

valveU0.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Valve threshold voltage. Forward voltage drop when the valve is conducting. Used in loss calculations, i.e. the switchLoss depend on numberOfValves * valveU0. Default: 0.0
